stories.text: I booked an appointment and went to the Apple store for a battery replacement a couple of months ago for my Macbook Pro. Before this I used to have the type you could replace yourself. I didn't realize until I spoke to the store employee that they wouldn't be able to do it then and there. I was told it needs to be sent away for at least one week.I can't do that so I did not get it done. So it's been two months and unfortunately I have to used it plugged in always and I'm starting to realize I'll never be able to get the battery replaced unless there's a same day service or I buy a second computer and sync it with my data and use it while the other one is getting a battery replacement. I'm curious how everyone else handles this situation, is same day service available from Apple in different locations or do people use a third party service?
stories.title: Ask HN: Any way to get MacBook Pro battery replaced same day?
